summary: The 'Teacher and School Leader Quality Partnership Grants Act' amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to enhance grants for teacher and school leader quality partnerships. The bill revises definitions related to educators and high-need schools, expands the purposes of the grants, and modifies the use of grant funds, including provisions for teaching and school leader residency programs and teacher leader development. It also strengthens accountability and evaluation measures, establishes a study on elevating the education profession, and updates administrative provisions. The bill aims to improve teacher and school leader preparation, professional development, and retention.
